body_html:
@peterjc123
Thanks to you, I can use pytorch in windows ! ty :D
However, I have 1 trouble with .cuda().
cnn_model.cuda() is working on windows, but rnn_model.cuda() is not working now.

Can you check the rnn.cuda() working?

I am using this code for CNN and this code for RNN and use Python 3.5.2, Anaconda

Error message is below.

File "main-gpu.py", line 60, in
rnn.cuda()
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 147, in cuda
return self._apply(lambda t: t.cuda(device_id))
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 118, in _apply
module._apply(fn)
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 116, in apply
self.flatten_parameters()
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 95, in flatten_parameters
fn.rnn_desc = rnn.init_rnn_descriptor(fn, handle)
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\rnn.py", line 54, in init_rnn_descriptor
fn.datatype
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init.py", line 229, in init
if version() >= 6000:
TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() >= int()
body_text:
@peterjc123
Thanks to you, I can use pytorch in windows ! ty  :D
However, I have 1 trouble with .cuda().
cnn_model.cuda() is working on windows, but rnn_model.cuda() is not working now.
Can you check the rnn.cuda() working?
I am using this code for CNN and this code for RNN and use Python 3.5.2, Anaconda
Error message is below.

File "main-gpu.py", line 60, in 
rnn.cuda()
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 147, in cuda
return self._apply(lambda t: t.cuda(device_id))
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 118, in _apply
module._apply(fn)
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 116, in apply
self.flatten_parameters()
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 95, in flatten_parameters
fn.rnn_desc = rnn.init_rnn_descriptor(fn, handle)
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\rnn.py", line 54, in init_rnn_descriptor
fn.datatype
File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn_init.py", line 229, in init
if version() >= 6000:
TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() >= int()
body:
@peterjc123 
Thanks to you, I can use pytorch in windows ! ty  :D
However, I have 1 trouble with .cuda().
cnn_model.cuda() is working on windows, but rnn_model.cuda() is not working now.

Can you check the rnn.cuda() working?

I am using [this code for CNN](https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/convolutional_neural_network/main-gpu.py) and [this code for RNN](https://github.com/yunjey/pytorch-tutorial/blob/master/tutorials/02-intermediate/bidirectional_recurrent_neural_network/main-gpu.py) and use Python 3.5.2, Anaconda

Error message is below.

> File "main-gpu.py", line 60, in <module>
    rnn.cuda()
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 147, in cuda
    return self._apply(lambda t: t.cuda(device_id))
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\module.py", line 118, in _apply
    module._apply(fn)
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 116, in _apply
    self.flatten_parameters()
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\nn\modules\rnn.py", line 95, in flatten_parameters
    fn.rnn_desc = rnn.init_rnn_descriptor(fn, handle)
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\rnn.py", line 54, in init_rnn_descriptor
    fn.datatype
  File "C:\Users\JeongHun\Anaconda3\lib\site-packages\torch\backends\cudnn\__init__.py", line 229, in __init__
    if version() >= 6000:
TypeError: unorderable types: NoneType() >= int()
